most recipes call for lean cuts like

steak which I'm going to generously salt

towels a lot of folks say not to wash
your mushrooms because you'll
waterlogged them but here's two facts
first mushrooms are dirty second
mushrooms are already full of water that
needs to be released throughout the
cooking process so just be sure to wash
them whole so they don't absorb as much

chopping into bite-sized pieces
next over on the stovetop in some smokin

rarer than where I wanted to end up

we're gonna reheat the beef in the pasta
which is gonna help finish it cooking
into our beautifully messy pot goes a

sense fell apart and we're gonna season

small shaped pasta of your choosing this

once the simmering liquid comes back
to a simmer we're going to optionally

if you do just make sure you add the

back over on the stovetop our pasta is
both absorbing and thickening the

everything is evenly incorporated
finished with a little chopped parsley
and season with kosher salt and freshly

is heated through and then you're ready
